title: Jonathan Hoefler
content:
Jonathan Hoefler is a typeface designer and an armchair type historian who specializes in the design of original typefaces. Named one of the forty most influential designers in America by _[I.D. Magazine](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/typophile.com/wiki/ID)_, Hoefler's publishing work includes award-winning original typeface designs for _[Rolling Stone](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rolling%20Stone)_, Harper's Bazaar, The New York Times Magazine, Sports Illustrated, and Esquire; his institutional clients range from the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum to the rock band They Might Be Giants. Perhaps his best known work is the [Hoefler Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Hoefler%20Text) family of typefaces, designed for [Apple Computer](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Apple%20Computer) and now appearing everywhere as part of the Macintosh operating system. Hoefler's work has been exhibited internationally, and is included in the permanent collection of the [Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Cooper-Hewitt%20National%20Design%20Museum) (Smithsonian Institution) in New York. In 2002, The Association Typographique Internationale ( [ATypI](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/typophile.com/wiki/ATypI)) presented Hoefler with its most prestigious award, the [Prix Charles Peignot](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Prix%20Charles%20Peignot) for oustanding contributions to type design.

Hoefler is the founder of [Hoefler & Frere-Jones](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Hoefler%20%2526%20Frere-Jones), the type foundry he runs with designer [Tobias Frere-Jones](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tobias%20Frere-Jones). The designer of more than five hundred typefaces, Hoefler's published work includes [Hoefler Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/hoeflertext/index.html) and [Hoefler Titling](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/hoeflertitling/index.html), [Knockout](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/index.html), [Mercury](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/mercurytext/index.html), [Requiem](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/requiem/index.html), and [The Proteus Project](http://web.archive.org/web/20150211195606/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/proteus/index.html).
